newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling weaker vs dlr in cautious trade.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling weaker vs dlr in cautious trade.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling was weakened on Monday dragged down by unmatched demand for dollars in a very thin trading session, commercial bank dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a mean shilling rate of 55.32 against the dollar from 54.90 on Friday while against the pound, the shilling was posted at a mean rate of 93.39 from 92.67.
"There is still a lot of demand for dollars," another dealer said.
But dealers said unlicensed pro-reform rallies planned for Monday by the opposition had slowed down business for the day with many fearing outbreaks of violence in the city.
"I think the market is going to close early today. There's no activity -- everyone's just sitting on the sidelines," one forex dealer said.
Meanwhile, the suspension of the weekly coffee auction for the next two weeks is expected to keep dollar inflows from coffee exporters at low levels, dealers said.
Coffee is one of Kenya's biggest foreign exchange earners. The money market continued tight with overnight rates quoted at 23 percent unchanged.
